channel.title: Running 2 servers at once?
channel.description:
Im hosting my server. And coding a 2nd
Help? I can run both at the same time.

item.title: Running 2 servers at once?
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:31, topic:378973”][quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=474829.msg3474271#msg3474271 date=1295557571]

guys I need help with this type of server thing, if I change the port it doesnt work… the server runs but the client wont login right, only if I change both back to 43594, all my servers only work at that I need help on changing one to 5555 and one to 43595. My comp is super fast so it should be fine I just need help getting them on all at once.

Duplicate both the client & server.
Edit the duplicated client & server to connect on port 5555.
Portforward to port 5555.
Run both sources.
Connect with both clients.

I can’t make it much simpler than that.
[/quote]The Player object and World handling instanced classes as well. Would it not be easier to set the port as a command line argument? That way you wouldn’t have to duplicate classes (making a mess).

I didn’t say duplicate the classes.
You cannot have ONE server and ONE client and connect through TWO ports at the same time. I don’t know if it’s possible (don’t think it is), but even if it is that’s only running one server.

I said DUPLICATE the server & client, not duplicate the server & client classes.[/quote]No not one client, but you could have a multi-world gameserver with one program (it would defeat the purpose of having multiple worlds). You would just have different instances for the PlayerHandling class on each port. That way the players situated on each world would not interact.

Anyways I read your original post incorrectly.

Read full topic

item.title: Running 2 servers at once?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:30, topic:378973”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=474829.msg3473544#msg3473544 date=1295484237]

guys I need help with this type of server thing, if I change the port it doesnt work… the server runs but the client wont login right, only if I change both back to 43594, all my servers only work at that I need help on changing one to 5555 and one to 43595. My comp is super fast so it should be fine I just need help getting them on all at once.

Duplicate both the client & server.
Edit the duplicated client & server to connect on port 5555.
Portforward to port 5555.
Run both sources.
Connect with both clients.

I can’t make it much simpler than that.
[/quote]The Player object and World handling instanced classes as well. Would it not be easier to set the port as a command line argument? That way you wouldn’t have to duplicate classes (making a mess).[/quote]
I didn’t say duplicate the classes.
You cannot have ONE server and ONE client and connect through TWO ports at the same time. I don’t know if it’s possible (don’t think it is), but even if it is that’s only running one server.

I said DUPLICATE the server & client, not duplicate the server & client classes.

Read full topic

item.title: Running 2 servers at once?
item.dc:creator: @Multiscape Multiscape
item.description:
@Multiscape wrote:

Xdivinex:

you can only run one server from one ip. so unless you have another computer you wont be able to do it.

You can. You need just to host them on different ports, e.g. “43594” and “5555”.

Read full topic

item.title: Running 2 servers at once?
item.dc:creator: @heroisgay heroisgay
item.description:
@heroisgay wrote:

[quote=“sageofmali, post:20, topic:378973”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=474829.msg3472520#msg3472520 date=1295396569]

Not on my computer, buddy.
[/quote]I lol’d. Looking at you say that makes you look like a complete moron.

I like how he (op) doesn’t comprehend things…He obviously didnt change one of the ips in the client… 0.0

/facepalm/

He’s using two different ports, not two different IP’s…
Also, he can just use localhost (0.0.0.0 for completely local).
He obviously didn’t change the port in one of the clients.

Are you guys talking about me? Lol, I changed ports to host 3 at a time.[/quote]
Re /facepalm Op= Original Poster, noone gives a shit how many servers you host at once btw.

Read full topic

jmood128:

You people are morons, if your hosting on other port also you have to port forward that new port.[/quote][quote=“eyeownyew, post:16, topic:378973”]Or forgetting to portforward 5555/43595?

Really? We’re the morons? Try reading the previous posts. I already suggested that.

You people are morons, if your hosting on other port also you have to port forward that new port. I suggest you just add RY’s port forwarding tool to your server… The only thing is you need a router that can enable Pnpu.

still doesnt work -.-

item.title: Running 2 servers at once?

you can only run one server from one ip. so unless you have another computer you wont be able to do it.

You moron, you can run as many servers as you want using the same ip. Each server just needs a different port.
[/quote]

Exactly what he said, also I recommend 43594 and 5555 instead of 43594 and 43595 being as its easy to confuse the 4 and 5 and cause errors…

Hope I helped[/quote]I bound my server to the ports 43594 and 43595 to prove it could be done. What need would I have in hosting two gameservers on my computer?
